definition: to knock down/to knock over/to run over (sb)
to knock against/to bump into/to run into/to meet by accident
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation

sentences.english: While the boy was crossing the street, a car knocked him down.
sentences.chinese: 正當這小男孩穿馬路的時候，一輛卡車把他撞倒了。

sentences.english: If an Englishman gets run down by a truck, he apologizes to the truck.
sentences.chinese: 如果一個英國人被一輛卡車撞倒，他向卡車道歉。

sentences.english: The boy bowled over the fence and flowers.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩撞倒了柵欄和花朵。

sentences.english: I step off the kerb and a cyclistnearly knocks me down.
sentences.chinese: 我從臺階上走下來一個汽車的人差點把我撞倒。

sentences.english: After being hit by the car, I have been dizzy.
sentences.chinese: 被汽車撞倒後，我一直處於瞢眩狀態。

sentences.english: A man was hit by a cab in the street.
sentences.chinese: 一個男人在街上被出租車撞倒送進了醫院。

sentences.english: I was almost knocked down by a motorcar.
sentences.chinese: 我差點被一輛汽車撞倒。

sentences.english: The car knocked down an old man who was walking on the zebracrossing.
sentences.chinese: 這輛汽車撞倒了一個正在過人行橫道線的老人。

sentences.english: Jack cycled too fast and almost ran down a school boy near the park.
sentences.chinese: 傑克車騎得太快了，在公園附近差一點撞倒一小學生。

sentences.english: He didn't seem at all upset at being almost knocked to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 他看上去對幾乎被撞倒在地毫不介意。

sentences.english: (Having been) Knocked down by a car, he spent a week in the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 被車子撞倒後，他在醫院裏度過了一星期。

sentences.english: She was knocked down by a car and badly mangled.
sentences.chinese: 她被一輛汽車撞倒而受重傷。

sentences.english: I then fell and smacked my head against the pavement.
sentences.chinese: 後來我摔倒了，頭撞倒了人行道上。

sentences.english: A dashing horse bowled him over .
sentences.chinese: 一匹狂奔的馬將他撞倒。

sentences.english: Mind how you go---- you nearly sent me flying.
sentences.chinese: 小心點，你差點把我撞倒。

sentences.english: The schoolboy was knocked down by a minibus when crossing the street.
sentences.chinese: 那名男生在穿過街道時讓一輛小公共汽車撞倒了。

definition: to knock against/to bump into/to run into/to meet by accident
to fall down/to slip and fall/to throw sb to the ground
collision/crash/to crash together/to collide with/to bump into
to step aside (for a passing vehicle)/to get out of the way/to make way for
to collide/jerking motion/to impinge/to offend/to provoke
